content: Yes, the current national executive director of the ACLU is Anthony D. Romero. He was appointed to this role in 2001 and is the first Latino and openly gay person to serve in this position. Romero's background includes extensive experience in civil rights and civil liberties advocacy. Prior to joining the ACLU, he served as director of the Immigrant Rights Project at the Ford Foundation and as a law clerk for the late U.S. Supreme Court Justice Thurgood Marshall. Romero has also served on numerous boards and advisory committees related to human rights and social justice issues, and he frequently speaks and writes about civil liberties and constitutional law. Under his leadership, the ACLU has focused on issues such as immigration, criminal justice reform, and defending the rights of people experiencing discrimination.
